Title: Postfix: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
A vulnerability has been found in Postfix, the worst of which
    possibly allowing remote code execution.

Background.Text: Postfix is Wietse Venemaâ€™s mailer that attempts to be fast, easy to administer, and secure, as an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.

Description.Text: A vulnerability have been discovered in Postfix. Please review the CVE identifier referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: An attacker could perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject SMTP commands during the plaintext to TLS session switch or might execute arbitrary code.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Postfix users should upgrade to the latest version:
